question: what's in a beam me up scotty
vanilla_rag_result:
The phrase "Beam me up, Scotty" is a catchphrase that originated from the science fiction television series "Star Trek." It is a command given by Captain Kirk to his chief engineer, Montgomery "Scotty" Scott, when he wants to be transported back to the Starship "Enterprise." The phrase has become a part of popular culture, although it is often misquoted; the closest actual line from the series is "Scotty, beam us up."

Additionally, "Beam Me Up, Scotty" is the title of a 1988 song by hip-hop artist D.C. Scorpio, which features a sample from another song called "Kill the Bitch" performed by Sasha. This song was released as the second single by D.C. Scorpio and is included in the compilation album "The Go Go Posse."
